page.title: 03A FRUIT FARM NEAR ABERNYTE
page.content: Eastern Ballindean Nursery is a small market garden of 5 acres.There is an old wall around it that was built in 1772.In 1946 the present owner started his market garden there.He grows Gooseberries,Brambles,Blackcurrants, Tayberries,Strawberries & Redcurrants that grow up the walls.At one time he sent his produce to market but now his customers come to his garden to buy.He employs children from Inchture to pick his crops in their School Holiday.His crops have changed over the years from fresh flowers and bulbs to soft fruits He works on his own with 2 tractors and 1 sprayer.The Pick Your Own Garden at East Ballindean next door doesn't affect his trade. He only uses one of his glasshouse now for some pot plants that he grows for fun to sell. He has to buy his new stock from the "Nuclear Stock Association".
